beats.label: HOOK
beats.narration: Here's where Grasshopper Adventure Series breaks you. 70 mi. Zone by zone.
beats.text_on_screen: Grasshopper Adventure Series — Where It Hurts
beats.visual: Full route map, then zoom into first zone
beats.editing_note: Start with full route visible, then rapid zoom in. Ominous music hit. Avatar suffering face.

beats.label: ZONE 1: Mile 12
beats.narration: Mile 12. The Terrain Lottery. Just when your legs find their rhythm on smooth pavement, the course dumps you onto loose gravel or packed dirt. Your bike choice starts mattering here. road bike riders begin questioning their life decisions.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Diverse - gravel roads, logging roads, singletrack, pavement. Varies significantly by event from 95% dirt (Low Gap) to 96% paved (King Ridge) to 100% off-road (Jackson Forest).

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 1 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).

beats.label: ZONE 2: Mile 28
beats.narration: Mile 28. Elevation Reality Check. The climbing starts getting serious with 12%+ pitches that don't care about your FTP. These aren't gentle wine country rollers. they're proper Northern California walls that separate the prepared from the optimistic.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Diverse - gravel roads, logging roads, singletrack, pavement. Varies significantly by event from 95% dirt (Low Gap) to 96% paved (King Ridge) to 100% off-road (Jackson Forest).

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 2 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).

beats.label: ZONE 3: Mile 45
beats.narration: Mile 45. The Technical Reckoning. Loose gravel descents and tight switchbacks where your bike handling skills get audited. This is where road racers learn why mountain bikers look so smug at the start line.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Diverse - gravel roads, logging roads, singletrack, pavement. Varies significantly by event from 95% dirt (Low Gap) to 96% paved (King Ridge) to 100% off-road (Jackson Forest).

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 3 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).

beats.label: ZONE 4: Mile 60
beats.narration: Mile 60. The Final Accounting. Your legs are already cooked from 60 miles of terrain chaos. And the course serves up one last climb to see if you've got anything left. Most don't.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation
